Computer Is Fast
Computer Is Fast

• This is the first impression of many beginners. • “FPGA is big.” • Program Creation Time > Execution Time
• This is the first impression of many beginners.
• “FPGA is big.”
• Program Creation Time > Execution Time

Sequencing in FPGA for Resource Control
Sequencing in FPGA for Resource Control

• Sequencing is a very efficient means of resource control in FPGA. • Reuse processing resource for similar function and/or different channels. • Pay attention to occasionally-used functions like initialization.
• Sequencing is a very efficient means of resource control in FPGA. • S e q u e n c i n g

sequencer in FPGA. The Conditional Branch Logic is added to support regular conditional branch as in micro-processors. The Loop & Return Logic + Stack are added to support FOR loops with pre-defined iterations at machine code level. The resource usage of ELMS in FPGA is very small.
sequencer in FPGA.
The Conditional Branch Logic is added to
support regular conditional branch as in
micro-processors.
The Loop & Return Logic + Stack are added
to support FOR loops with pre-defined
iterations at machine code level.
The resource usage of ELMS in FPGA is very
small.

• • Regular micro-processor treat the sequence as unknown. • ELMS supports FOR loops with pre-defined iterations at machine code level.

it is possible.

Do You SUDOKU?
Do You SUDOKU?

• Fill in 1-9 so that:
• Fill in 1-9 so that:

– Each column contains 1-9 without repeating. – Each row contains 1-9
– Each column contains
1-9 without repeating.
– Each row contains 1-9

– Each 3x3 box contains 1-9 without repeating.
– Each 3x3 box contains
1-9 without repeating.

• It is fun to solve by
• It is fun to solve by

• It is also fun to write a solver program, or read a good one.
• It is also fun to write a
solver program, or
read a good one.

A Possible SUDOKU Solver?
A Possible SUDOKU Solver?

• For all empty boxes, assign 1-9 to each. • Check correct or not. • If not, repeat.
• For all empty boxes,
assign 1-9 to each.
• Check correct or not.
• If not, repeat.

81-28=53 empty boxes 9 possibilities for each box. Total possibilities 953. Assume a computer checks 1010 possibilities/sec. A year = 3x107 sec. Total time to solve: 953 /(1010 x 3x107) >> 1000 years

Use early constraints number of iterations.

number of iterations.

– Data item with 2 free parameters. – # of measurements - # of constraints = 2. – A triplet is not necessarily a straight track
– Data item with 2 free parameters.

– A triplet is not necessarily a straight track

– A triplet may have more than 3

• Circular track with known interaction point is a

triplet since it has 2 free parameters. (Otherwise it has 3 parameters.)

Least-Square (LS) Track Fitter
Least-Square (LS) Track Fitter

• Standard least square fitting uses large amount of
• Standard least square fitting uses large amount of

multiplications and possibly divisions.
multiplications and possibly divisions. m u l t i p l i c a t i o n s a n d
p o s s i b l y
d i v i s i o n s .

Multiplier-less (ML) Track Fitter
Multiplier-less (ML) Track Fitter

• The coefficients are scaled to avoid using dividers. • The coefficients for ML approximate fitting algorithm are
• The coefficients are scaled to avoid using dividers.
• The coefficients for ML approximate fitting algorithm are

“two-bit” integers. The full multiplications are replaced by two integer shift-additions
“two-bit” integers. The full multiplications are replaced by
two integer shift-additions

Errors of LS and ML Track Fitters
Errors of LS and ML Track Fitters

• The errors of ML approximate fitting algorithm are only
• The errors of ML approximate fitting algorithm are only

slightly larger than LS fitting errors..
slightly larger than LS fitting errors..

Errors Several Track Fitters
Errors Several Track Fitters

• Generally speaking, more computations yield better quality of the results. • However, after certain point, the quality of the results does not improve as
• Generally speaking, more computations yield better quality of the results.
• However, after certain point, the quality of the results does not improve as

rapidly as before. It is common that large amount of computation brings only small improvement in the mathematically perfect algorithms.
rapidly as before.
It is common that large amount of computation brings only small improvement
in the mathematically perfect algorithms.

Consider resource/power friendly algorithms such as multiplier-less, divider-less algorithms.
Consider resource/power friendly
algorithms such as multiplier-less,
divider-less algorithms.

resource became non-critical, if not impossible.

Circular Tracks from Collision Point on Cylindrical Detectors
Circular Tracks from Collision Point
on Cylindrical Detectors

• For a given hit on layer 3, the coincident between a layer 2 and a layer 1 hit satisfying coincident map signifies a valid circular track.
• For a given hit on layer 3, the coincident between a layer 2 and a
layer 1 hit satisfying coincident map signifies a valid circular track.

• A track segment has 2 free parameters, i.e., a triplet. • The coincident map is invariant of rotation.
• A track segment has 2 free parameters, i.e., a triplet.
• The coincident map is invariant of rotation.

Tiny Triplet Finder Reuse Coincident Logic via Shifting Hit Patterns
Tiny Triplet Finder
Reuse Coincident Logic via Shifting Hit Patterns

One set of coincident logic is implemented.
One set of coincident
logic is implemented.

For an arbitrary hit on C3, rotate, i.e., shift the hit patterns for C1 and C2 to search for coincidence.
For an arbitrary hit on C3, rotate, i.e., shift the hit
patterns for C1 and C2 to search for coincidence.

Tiny Triplet Finder for Circular Tracks
Tiny Triplet Finder for Circular Tracks

with more
than 3 layers
